page.title: 17Hooligans & vandalism
page.content: There is nothing much to do in the evenings particularly for young people. In the summer they hang about the bridge at the end of Chapel Lane, there is usually no trouble but people who live nearby complain about bad language and the noise because some of the boys have motorbikes. The telephone box is vandalised by having its windows broken, now they are made of plastic but this is covered in names scratched on. The village notice board is often wrecked & the bus shelter is covered with graffiti. Not long ago a gang of youths came from Benson & Wallingford, there was a big fight to which the police were called. Even at Youth Club things get busted up just for "fun". I think it's silly.
